content.description: Start on chalked jug on the left side of the small detached boulder at the base of the main boulder. Make a big reach straight up to a great slot hold. Reach right into a right trending crack that thins to the right. Don't follow the crack very far, the next holds are on the lip straight above. The top out a bit precarious, but easier to the left.
Start on a subtle fin, low on the right arete. Follow great holds on the arete to the point of the arete and top out on the right side of the arete.

Sit start on a very low protruding fin and make a tough cramped move up to some better holds. Continue moving straight up through small left facing holds to a big reach to a good jugs. Jugs to topout.
content.location: Start on the far left side of the boulder, with your back to the reservoir

pathTokens: Rocky Gorge Reservoir  (T. Howard Duckett Reservoir)

content.description: Access Note: These climbs are located on private property owned and maintained by WSSC Water. Per the watershed recreation regulations climbing is prohibited. Recreational activities permitted in designated areas include: shore fishing, boat fishing from approved craft, boating from rowboats, canoes, kayaks, and sailboats, picnicking, horseback trail riding and hunting. See wsscwater.com/watershed for more details.Â A west facing (toward) river boulder with big, sharp holds in a 20 degree overhang. Failed to identify this boulder from the information on Rockclimbing.com, though it has clearly been climbed. Any info volunteered will gladly be used to update this area and its climbs.
